The new malaise of civilization: When words, truth and reality fall apart
subhead: The proliferation of wars, increase in mental health disorders, devaluation of speech, and loss of connection to reality are troubling signs of the tipping point our societies are facing. Nearly a century ago, Freud identified a malaise that resonates with what we are going through today.

subhead: Benjamin Netanyahu has methodically dismantled the policies of the Labor prime minister who was assassinated by a far-right activist on November 4, 1995, blaming him in particular for signing the Oslo Accords.

title: The rise of 'crypto bros' and neoliberalism in France's business schools
subhead: Student societies, blockchain clubs and crypto and Web3 conferences are bringing together a young generation of fintech fanatics, pushing ideas inspired by radical neoliberalism.

title: Is it ever a good idea to… wear your sweater draped over your shoulders?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: French lawmakers vote to tax American retirees who freely benefit from social security
subhead: Members of the Assemblée Nationale backed an amendment to the social security that would create a 'minimum contribution' on foreign retirees who receive free healthcare.

title: Life after terror for France's most famous prosecutor
subhead: François Molins was the face of the fight against terrorism in France during the 2010s, after the country faced a wave of jihadist attacks. Ahead of the 10th anniversary of the November 13, 2015, attacks, Molins, now retired, continues to tirelessly defend democracy.
